adventure_overview: Tigers will have fun making their own shield or coat of arms and even a castle. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Discuss with your den or Tiger adult partner what it means to have courteousÂ  behavior, how a knight behaves. Tell another Tiger which points of the Scout Law help you to have the same Knightly behavior.

activities.name: Courteous Knights
activities.description: Cub Scouts will act out acts of being courteous and other points of the Scout Law.

activities.name: Modern Knights
activities.description: Have a guest speaker from one of the armed services come to speak about the values and creed of their branch.

requirements.text: Create a shield that can be for your den or a personal shield.

activities.name: Den Shield
activities.description: Working together as a den make a den shield.

activities.name: Personal Little Shield
activities.description: Make a personal little shield out of plywood and decorate it with paint.

activities.name: Personal Shield
activities.description: Cub Scouts make a personal shield from project board.

requirements.text: Using recycled and other materials, design and build a small castle in your den or at home.

activities.name: Building Sandcastles
activities.description: Use a sandbox for the den to create a den sandcastle.

activities.name: Castle Made of Building Blocks
activities.description: Make a castle using modular building blocks such as Legos

activities.name: Yesterdays Trash is Todays Castle
activities.description: Using recycled or reused materials, build a model castle.
